ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: With Professor Ngame's help, I expanded my range of spoken and written French beyond that of L1. In addition to learning new vocabulary and more advanced sentence structure, I gained a deeper appreciation for French and Francophone cultural diversity. I highly recommend taking the class with Professor Ngame as he is a phenomenal instructor and brings an unparalleled wealth of knowledge and experience to the classroom.
I greatly improved my French grammar and vocabulary skills. I also learned how to write and speak in French.
I learned a lot about conjugations
I significantly improved my french grammar and vocabulary.
I learned so much grammar (specifically tenses) and new vocabulary.
I developed a deeper appreciation and understanding of the French language. I also developed a more intuitive relationship with French.
Beyond solely the French language, I learned about how interconnected French is with English and with other romance languages. The French influence is in more places than I imagined.
I gained a much deeper understanding of French and am more comfortable speaking and using the limited French I now know.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I'm a big fan of French in Action, but I would argue that more updated mediums of instruction should be brought in as well. If possible, it would be nice to speak with French peers, thereby giving students a more contemporary understanding of the culture and language.
The strengths were definitely how engaged the students and professor were as well as the class discussions. I can't think of any weaknesses at this time as I think it was a very strong course.
It could be improved by going a little slower
I think this was a very well organized course but due largely to the efforts of professor Ngame.
There is always more practice to do! Take that as you will.
I believe that the strengths were the active engagement in class and homework assignments. I think that the French in Action program is helpful, but culturally inappropriate and outdated.

The course could incorporate more modern French and/or more colloquial language. Also, it would be interesting to follow French politics and news as an assignment. I do enjoy the structure of the course very much and the way that verbs and conjugations are taught in particular.
I really love the 'learn through doing' way that this course is taught and the French In Action series. It's been so helpful to be able to use French as it is really used in conversation.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend taking French 120 as it continues to build up one's understanding of the French language.
I definitely would recommend this course if you're looking to improve your French skills. It's a very interesting and engaging class and the professor manages to make it fun and exciting.
Yes but you have to reallyyyyy want to learn french
Yes. It truly improved my French although the time commitment was significant.
I would definitely take this course if taught by professor Ngame. He is the one of the best professors I have had at Yale, who will work with you one in one as much as you need to help you.
Yes. I would let them know that they will learn a significant amount for only taking a course for one semester, but that will come with a large amount of work.
Absolutely! This class has been a great experience.

Definitely! This course was tough and has a heavy workload but was such a joy! It's such an incredible feeling to be able to use a language and engage with speakers of that language when you never could before.
